answers.answer: The test just monitors the baby's heartbeat and your uterus. I did it. I had gd. You can eat whatever you want but you have to limit your carb and sweet intake. Your midwife should have you meet with a dietician the diet isn't hard and I still mostly ate everything the same just smaller portions of the carbs.

As long as you go by the diet and keep your sugars down your baby will be fine.:) I'm not sure how high your sugars were but I cut out sugary things and I go walking twice a day. Stay away from sweets,potatoes and be carful with bread. Drink lots of water.
Just follow the appropriate diet and you'll be fine. So will baby. If you stress your body out and don't do what you're supposed to, that is possible.  Just keep your sugars where they need to be.

question: What can I eat? I heard it can cause still birth! I'm beyond terrified. Does anybody else have or been through this? My midwife and sending me twice a week to do stress tests what is that about? Does it help?
title: gestational diabetes?
